item.title: Create Favorites Table...
item.help: Create a favorites (SDX$FAVTORITES) table in the current schema to hold favorites folders and object references.

prompt.label: WARNING! This action will issue a commit on the current connection.
Commit State
prompt.default: select NVL2(dbms_transaction.local_transaction_id, '*** Transactions Pending ***', 'It appears no transactions are pending') from dual

confirmation.title: Favorites Table Created
confirmation.prompt:
WARNING! The objects in the favorites folders are just that. Any action on one affects the 'real' thing.

A default favorites folder has been created. Deleting a favorites folder will remove the references from favorites but not affect the 'real' object.

You will need to disconnect and reconnect for the favorites folder in the navigator to appear.

item.title: Drop Favorites Table...
item.help: Drop the favorites (SDX$FAVTORITES) table in the current schema that holds favorites folders and object references.

prompt.label: WARNING! This action will issue a commit on the current connection.
Commit State
prompt.default: select NVL2(dbms_transaction.local_transaction_id, '*** Transactions Pending ***', 'It appears no transactions are pending') from dual

item.title: Add Folder...

prompt.label: WARNING! This action will issue a commit on the current connection.
Commit State
prompt.default: select NVL2(dbms_transaction.local_transaction_id, '*** Transactions Pending ***', 'It appears no transactions are pending') from dual

item.title: Delete Folder...

prompt.label:
WARNING! This action will issue a commit on the current connection.

Delete #OBJECT_NAME#?
Commit State
prompt.default: select NVL2(dbms_transaction.local_transaction_id, '*** Transactions Pending ***', 'It appears no transactions are pending') from dual

item.title: Add to favorites...

prompt.label: Folder Name
prompt.value: SELECT OBJECT_NAME FROM SDX$FAVORITES WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = 'FAV_FOLDER'

prompt.label: WARNING! This action will issue a commit on the current connection.
Commit State
prompt.default: select NVL2(dbms_transaction.local_transaction_id, '*** Transactions Pending ***', 'It appears no transactions are pending') from dual
